metadata.synopsis: Default dialogue - the conversation you can have with Shadowheart at any time when she's a member of your party. You can ask her about herself, or events that you've experienced together during your adventures. Her responses to you may differ slightly depending on her current attitude towards you.

3.speaker: Shadowheart
3.text: Speaking out of turn is an indiscretion. Trying to drink my blood is something else entirely.
3.context: InternalNodeContext: Character saw Astarion use his 'bite' ability on someone else (probably in combat, but not necessarily) and confronts him about being a vampire.NodeContext: Confrontational. Just learned Astarion is a vampire after he bit someone

189.speaker: Shadowheart
189.text: Don't try it again. If you feel the urge, go find yourself a sheep or something.

23.speaker: Shadowheart
23.text: So you're a vampire, Astarion? I suppose I shouldn't really act surprised - the signs are not exactly subtle, if you care to look.
23.context: InternalNodeContext: Character saw Astarion use his 'bite' ability on someone else (probably in combat, but not necessarily) and confronts him about being a vampire.NodeContext: Confrontational. Just learned Astarion is a vampire after he bit someone

220.speaker: Shadowheart
220.text: Perhaps I should have said something before you actually bit someone.
220.context: NodeContext: Confrontational. Just learned Astarion is a vampire after he bit someone

24.speaker: Narrator
24.text: *A dreadful idea. Shadowheart hasn't exactly warmed to you so far - she's bound to take the revelation badly.*
24.context: NodeContext: A little hurt. Astarion, who she has a good relationship with up until, confessed he's a vampire. This reaction is due to a failed skillcheck - she can also react more positively elsewhere.

55.speaker: Player
55.context: NodeContext: A little hurt. Astarion, who she has a good relationship with up until, confessed he's a vampire. This reaction is due to a failed skillcheck - she can also react more positively elsewhere.

17.speaker: Shadowheart
17.text: You know... I had my suspicions, but I didn't want to act on them. And now it seems I won't have to.
17.context: NodeContext: A little hurt. Astarion, who she has a good relationship with up until, confessed he's a vampire. This reaction is due to a failed skillcheck - she can also react more positively elsewhere.

148.speaker: Shadowheart
148.text: You know... I had my suspicions, but I didn't want to act on them. And now it seems I won't have to.

188.text: And you've been keeping this from me all this time...? I thought we trusted one another.
188.context: NodeContext: A little hurt. Astarion, who she has a good relationship with up until, confessed he's a vampire. This reaction is due to a failed skillcheck - she can also react more positively elsewhere.

90.speaker: Shadowheart
90.text: And you've been keeping this from me all this time...? I thought we trusted one another.
90.context: NodeContext: A little hurt. Astarion, who she has a good relationship with up until, confessed he's a vampire. This reaction is due to a failed skillcheck - she can also react more positively elsewhere.

145.speaker: Shadowheart
145.text: So... a vampire spawn. Is my throat safe?

53.speaker: Shadowheart
53.text: Somehow, I'm not sure I'll take your word for it just yet. A little more trust needs to be cultivated first.

175.speaker: Player
175.text: I have more important things to worry about than your throat - the tadpole, for one.

48.speaker: Shadowheart
48.text: Concerned about turning into a monster? You're already halfway there, by most standards.

181.speaker: Shadowheart
181.text: Well the truth's out now, for what it's worth. Are we done?

162.speaker: Shadowheart
162.text: True. Your proclivities might not matter at all soon enough, if we don't find a cure.

206.speaker: Player
206.text: From me, at least. But if my old master comes knocking, all bets are off.

82.speaker: Shadowheart
82.text: I sincerely hope you're worth the trouble.

78.speaker: Shadowheart
78.text: Well, let's hope he keeps his distance.

87.speaker: Shadowheart
87.text: Well, the truth's out now, in either case. Did you want something else?

98.speaker: Player
98.context: NodeContext: 'Just my luck'/some exasperation. Astarion just confessed he's a vampire.

234.speaker: Shadowheart
234.text: You know... I had my suspicions, but I didn't want to act on them. And now it seems I won't have to.

164.speaker: Shadowheart
164.text: You know... I had my suspicions, but I didn't want to act on them. And now it seems I won't have to.

173.text: I knew there was something untrustworthy about you.

187.speaker: Shadowheart
187.text: I knew there was something untrustworthy about you.

191.speaker: Player
191.context: NodeContext: 'Just my luck'/some exasperation. Astarion just confessed he's a vampire.

116.speaker: Shadowheart
116.text: Hells. Why can't I just have normal, boring companions? I should be grateful you told me, at least.
116.context: NodeContext: 'Just my luck'/some exasperation. Astarion just confessed he's a vampire.

33.speaker: Player
33.text: Change your mind. The secret can keep for now.
33.context: NodeContext: Slight bemusement (avatar astarion considered confessing he is a vampire, only change his  mind  and say nothing)

138.speaker: Shadowheart
138.text: You have a faraway look on your face, Astarion. Did you forget what you were going to say? Happens to the best of us.
138.context: NodeContext: Slight bemusement (avatar astarion considered confessing he is a vampire, only change his  mind  and say nothing)

32.speaker: Shadowheart
32.text: So you're not in full control of your faculties. If you think it might happen again, warn me. I would hate to have to kill you.

43.speaker: Shadowheart
43.context: InternalNodeContext: Character was bitten by Astarion in gameplay.NodeContext: Outraged. Astarion just bit her.

47.speaker: Shadowheart
47.text: I should have known you were a vampire - the signs were there.
47.context: NodeContext: Outraged. Astarion just bit her.

213.speaker: Player
213.text: Calm down - I'm on your side. I just got a little... peckish.

45.speaker: Shadowheart
45.text: What happened was my dagger finding the back of her throat.

70.speaker: Shadowheart
70.text: Are you looking for the lurid details?

199.speaker: Shadowheart
199.text: You do that. I'll do something more productive, like find a cure.

176.speaker: Player
176.text: It was always an uneasy pairing. I'm going to just trust that you had your reasons.

104.speaker: Shadowheart
104.text: That is... a great deal of trust.

211.speaker: Shadowheart
211.text: I appreciate it, but keep your guard up around others. We're gathering enemies by the day.

125.speaker: Player
125.text: No details. I just want to know how you feel about it.

240.speaker: Shadowheart
240.text: Plumbing for guilt is pointless. I did what I must.

67.speaker: Shadowheart
67.text: I won't regret defending myself. There's nothing more to it.

120.speaker: Player
120.text: My kin is dead. Perhaps I should avenge her.

0.speaker: Shadowheart
0.text: Please, she was weak. Your kind don't avenge those who fail.

46.speaker: Shadowheart
46.text: I understand why you ask but memory loss is not as uncommon as you'd think. There may be other causes.

56.speaker: Shadowheart
56.text: I've seen your resolve. Whatever is trying to control you, you're stronger.

60.speaker: Narrator
60.text: *Is this a good idea, you wonder? You and Shadowheart have a certain rapport, but is it strong enough to weather such a revelation?*

61.speaker: Shadowheart
61.text: I suppose that makes you quite remarkable... though not in a way I'd envy, perhaps.

241.speaker: Shadowheart
241.text: Lady Shar chose me also, but because of the blood I spilled, not what flows in my veins. You are born of murder itself... perhaps your fate is out of your hands.

140.speaker: Shadowheart
140.text: From what little I can recall hearing of Bhaal's mortal children, not all succumbed to his influence. Perhaps you can still resist your nature... if you want to.

63.speaker: Shadowheart
63.text: How kind of you to remind me. But I don't think so - you've a tadpole too and seem stronger than ever.
63.context: InternalNodeContext: Avatar Astarion tried to bite this companion during the night, but you woke up and discovered he was a vampire. You talked it through and resolved things peacefully in CAMP_AstarionHunger_IVB_SCO_Avatar_Choice.lsjNodeContext: Lingering sore feelings/suspicion. Caught avatar Astarion trying to drink her blood the night before, but he made amends.

71.speaker: Shadowheart
71.text: How kind of you to remind me. But I don't think so - you've a tadpole too and seem stronger than ever.
71.context: InternalNodeContext: Avatar Astarion tried to bite this companion during the night, but you woke up and discovered he was a vampire. You talked it through and resolved things peacefully in CAMP_AstarionHunger_IVB_SCO_Avatar_Choice.lsjNodeContext: Lingering sore feelings/suspicion. Caught avatar Astarion trying to drink her blood the night before, but he made amends.

80.speaker: Shadowheart
80.text: I'll just have to try get some more rest when we next stop to camp...

84.speaker: Shadowheart
84.text: She went mad, now she's dead. What's there to talk about?
84.context: InternalNodeContext: Avatar Astarion tried to bite this companion during the night, but you woke up and discovered he was a vampire. You talked it through and resolved things peacefully in CAMP_AstarionHunger_IVB_SCO_Avatar_Choice.lsjNodeContext: Lingering sore feelings/suspicion. Caught avatar Astarion trying to drink her blood the night before, but he made amends.

40.speaker: Shadowheart
40.text: No loss to our little venture, either way.

10.speaker: Player
10.text: There's more to this, I'm sure of it.

81.speaker: Shadowheart
81.text: Don't waste your time deciphering the actions of a lunatic.

136.speaker: Player
136.text: Are you all right? You were wounded.

197.speaker: Shadowheart
197.text: Only a glancing blow. Clearly gith aren't quite the killers they believe themselves to be.

27.speaker: Player
27.text: First you exhibit strange magic, now Lae'zel explodes. That sounds like a link to me.

223.speaker: Shadowheart
223.text: It isn't. Now let's leave it at that.

227.speaker: Shadowheart
227.text: And by that, I mean, never bring up the subject again.

59.speaker: Player
59.text: People don't just explode. I assume that's true of gith too.

205.speaker: Shadowheart
205.text: And people don't just hear each other's thoughts, or turn into monsters. And yet...

146.speaker: Shadowheart
146.text: There's nothing more for you to uncover here. Let it rest.

94.speaker: Shadowheart
94.text: I'm surprised I managed to get some rest, after last night's interruption.
94.context: InternalNodeContext: Avatar Astarion tried to bite this companion during the night, but you woke up and discovered he was a vampire. You talked it through and resolved things peacefully in CAMP_AstarionHunger_IVB_SCO_Avatar_Choice.lsjNodeContext: Lingering sore feelings/suspicion. Caught avatar Astarion trying to drink her blood the night before, but he made amends.

207.speaker: Shadowheart
207.text: Would you have had the self-control to not drain me dry if I hadn't stirred? I'm not sure I want to think about it.
207.context: NodeContext: Lingering sore feelings/suspicion. Caught avatar Astarion trying to drink her blood the night before, but he made amends.

77.speaker: Shadowheart
77.text: I hope you can keep your cravings in check, going forward. Otherwise, I think you and I will be parting ways - understood?
77.context: NodeContext: Ultimatum. Willing to let it go if Astarion behaves.

51.speaker: Player
51.context: NodeContext: Ultimatum. Willing to let it go if Astarion behaves.

4.speaker: Player
4.text: Don't worry, from now on I'll focus on our enemies.
4.context: NodeContext: Ultimatum. Willing to let it go if Astarion behaves.

39.speaker: Shadowheart
39.text: Fine. But don't take me for granted - not my company, and certainly not my blood.
39.context: NodeContext: Ultimatum. Willing to let it go if Astarion behaves.

124.speaker: Shadowheart
124.text: A vampire among us? So be it.
124.context: CinematicNodeContext: Said to Astarion directlyNodeContext: Said to Astarion directly

238.speaker: Lae'zel
238.text: A vampire among us? So be it.
238.context: CinematicNodeContext: Said to Astarion directlyNodeContext: Said to Astarion directly

129.speaker: Lae'zel
129.text: But should I wake with so much as a drop of blood on my neck, I will end him.

36.speaker: Lae'zel
36.text: For his sake, he best not develop an appetite for githyanki.

64.speaker: Shadowheart
64.text: I'd just better not wake in the night to find fangs at my throat.

149.speaker: Wyll
149.text: Fine - as long as he keeps his fangs off our necks.

110.speaker: Gale
110.text: Oh, and a quick word of warning, Astarion: I taste absolutely awful. Keep your distance.

66.speaker: Gale
66.text: I'd advise against satisfying your hunger on me. Who knows what the orb might do if it realises its host is the one being drained.

117.speaker: Karlach
117.text: Yeah. And I'm way too hot to touch.

208.speaker: Wyll
208.text: Hunting with vampires? Never thought I'd see the day.
208.context: CinematicNodeContext: Said to Astarion directlyNodeContext: Said to Astarion directly

74.speaker: Wyll
74.text: Very well - but I'm keeping an eye on you. And no wisecracks about having us for supper.
74.context: CinematicNodeContext: Said to Astarion directlyNodeContext: Said to Astarion directly

155.speaker: Gale
155.text: So we're travelling with a vampire, are we? Of course we are.

178.speaker: Gale
178.text: A word of warning, Astarion: I taste absolutely awful.

112.speaker: Gale
112.text: I'd advise against satisfying your hunger on me. Who knows what the orb might do if it realises its host is the one being drained.

202.speaker: Karlach
202.text: Vamps don't scare me. As long as they keep their teeth to themselves.

219.speaker: Karlach
219.text: No sense judging someone for who they are. Except devils, obviously.

15.speaker: Player
15.text: A vamp, huh? Interesting. Keep your teeth to yourself, Astarion, and we won't have any issues.

9.speaker: Karlach
9.text: A vamp, huh? Interesting. Keep your teeth to yourself, Astarion, and we won't have any issues.

22.speaker: Karlach
22.text: Anyway, you'd burn your tongue off if you went for this neck.

92.speaker: Player
92.text: A vampire could make for an interesting ally in combat, if nothing else.

135.speaker: Shadowheart
135.text: A vampire could make for an interesting ally in combat, if nothing else.

89.speaker: Gale
89.text: So we're travelling with a vampire, are we?

214.speaker: Gale
214.text: A word of warning, Astarion: I taste absolutely awful. Keep your distance.

250.speaker: Gale
250.text: I'd advise against satisfying your hunger on me. Who knows what the orb might do if it realises its host is the one being drained.

144.speaker: Player
144.text: I promise, I'll do my best to resist my hunger.

102.speaker: Shadowheart
102.text: Lady Shar willed it to fall... though even I won't quite revel in all those deaths as much as you. The unfaithful were vanquished, but I have little interest in slavering over their corpses.

105.speaker: Shadowheart
105.text: Lady Shar willed it to fall... though even I won't quite revel in all those deaths as much as you. The unfaithful were vanquished, but I have little interest in slavering over their corpses.

108.speaker: Shadowheart
108.text: Lady Shar willed it to fall... though even I won't quite revel in all those deaths as much as you. The unfaithful were vanquished, but I have little interest in slavering over their corpses.

121.speaker: Shadowheart
121.text: Good. I knew you had what it took to quieten your demons. I'd hate to have lost the real you.

122.speaker: Narrator
122.text: *You and Shadowheart have forged a strong bond. Surely she will understand...*

152.speaker: Shadowheart
152.text: We aren't dear friends now, if that's what you're asking.

25.speaker: Shadowheart
25.text: But I trust we can all sleep a little more soundly in camp now.

128.speaker: Player
128.text: I'll be keeping an eye on both of you. I don't want a fight happening again.

204.speaker: Shadowheart
204.text: Relax. We'll kiss and make up on our own time.

169.speaker: Shadowheart
169.text: Someone prodding at a newly opened wound doesn't help matters.

119.speaker: Shadowheart
119.text: And get murdered by a pack of goblins or gnolls instead?

29.speaker: Shadowheart
29.text: Lae'zel might be a reluctant ally, but she is good at killing. I'll point her in their direction.

34.speaker: Player
34.text: That's good. I'd rather keep things friendly between all of us.

182.speaker: Shadowheart
182.text: You have an interesting definition of 'friendly', but yes.

215.speaker: Shadowheart
215.text: No, I think you'd stab me from the front, if it came to that.

62.speaker: Shadowheart
62.text: We could always spar if you want to practise.

159.speaker: Shadowheart
159.text: When we make it to Baldur's Gate, you'll be at home in the slaughterhouses.

160.speaker: Shadowheart
160.text: I'd be lying if I said I hadn't noticed the spasms and the fainting spells. You have my commiserations - I think I know how it must feel, in a sense.
160.context: InternalNodeContext: Avatar Astarion tried to bite A DIFFERENT companion during the night, but they woke up and discovered he was a vampire. They talked it through and resolved things peacefully in CAMP_AstarionHunger_IVB_SCO_Avatar_Choice.lsjNodeContext: A little confrontational. Astarion was outed as a vampire after trying to feed on someone else

165.speaker: Shadowheart
165.text: So you're a vampire, Astarion? I suppose I shouldn't really act surprised - the signs are not exactly subtle, if you care to look.
165.context: InternalNodeContext: Avatar Astarion tried to bite A DIFFERENT companion during the night, but they woke up and discovered he was a vampire. They talked it through and resolved things peacefully in CAMP_AstarionHunger_IVB_SCO_Avatar_Choice.lsjNodeContext: A little confrontational. Astarion was outed as a vampire after trying to feed on someone else

115.speaker: Shadowheart
115.text: Still, we're lucky nobody died - I hope you can keep your cravings in check, going forward. Otherwise, I think you and I will be parting ways - understood?
115.context: NodeContext: Ultimatum. Willing to let it go if Astarion behaves.

168.speaker: Shadowheart
168.text: You and I have markedly different ideas of what amounts to a gift...

196.speaker: Shadowheart
196.text: You're hardly alone - bloodletting is quite popular of late. Though your twinge of conscience sets you apart from the brigands, monsters and kill-happy fiends of the world...

35.speaker: Shadowheart
35.text: Whatever you think may be compelling you... you may have greater ability to resist it than you realise. Everyone has unseemly thoughts. Being able to quieten them is what sets us apart from the beasts.

192.speaker: Shadowheart
192.text: So, your very own queen has turned on you...? Your people are nothing if not ruthless.

193.speaker: Shadowheart
193.text: So, your very own queen has turned on you...? Your people are nothing if not ruthless.

86.speaker: Shadowheart
86.text: You have my sympathies - especially after what Shar did to me. Perhaps you and I met the same ill fortune in who we came to serve.

225.speaker: Player
225.text: Thank you for your clumsy platitudes and maudlin sympathies.

242.speaker: Shadowheart
242.text: Careful. I'm not sure I can withstand the charm.

44.speaker: Player
44.text: I don't want to discuss it.

233.speaker: Shadowheart
233.text: Then I won't breathe another word about it. But the sentiment remains the same. Chin up.

114.speaker: Shadowheart
114.text: I'm not entirely without sympathy, I should say. I can't imagine what I'd do if Lady Shar abandoned me.

194.speaker: Player
194.text: Don't give it a second thought. I'll persevere.

7.speaker: Shadowheart
7.text: I don't doubt that, funnily enough.

83.speaker: Player
83.text: You speak with all the sincerity of a vulture pecking at carrion.

12.speaker: Shadowheart
12.text: I tried. Enjoy your new status as pariah.

137.speaker: Player
137.text: Pray that you never find yourself in the same position.

130.speaker: Shadowheart
130.text: I'm not entirely without sympathy, I should say. To fall out with someone you revered... it must be catastrophic.

201.speaker: Shadowheart
201.text: No, I don't think so - you've a tadpole as well but you see fine...

232.speaker: Shadowheart
232.text: I never claimed to be wise, unfortunately.

127.speaker: Shadowheart
127.text: I think you may find you have more than a little healthy competition from would-be tyrants.
127.context: NodeContext: Tough. Arc: Shadowheart remains loyal to Shar.

142.speaker: Shadowheart
142.text: Lady Shar is patient though - she can wait until the rest of you have torn each other apart.

179.speaker: Shadowheart
179.text: You're the last thing the world needs - another would-be tyrant who thinks they have divine rights. You're just someone's pawn, you know. That's all we are to the gods.
179.context: NodeContext: Tough. Arc: Shadowheart has rejected Shar

243.speaker: Shadowheart
243.text: If you say so. Our last discussion grew... heated. I'd rather not repeat it.
243.context: NodeContext: Tiny hint of understanding between frenemies.

174.speaker: Player
174.text: Our enmity is a festering wound - it weakens us both. It must be sucked clean.
174.context: NodeContext: Tiny hint of understanding between frenemies.

126.speaker: Shadowheart
126.text: Gods... I both understand what you mean and am horrified you phrased it like that.

85.speaker: Player
85.text: I confronted you in Vlaakith's name. Our conflict serves no purpose now.
85.context: NodeContext: Tiny hint of understanding between frenemies.

218.speaker: Shadowheart
218.text: Your queen turned on you, and my goddess turned on me. Perhaps we have more in common than we dare admit to.
218.context: NodeContext: Tiny hint of understanding between frenemies.

186.speaker: Shadowheart
186.text: I see. It must be difficult, have someone you revere turn on you. I'm willing to let the past go, if you are as well.
186.context: NodeContext: Tiny hint of understanding between frenemies.

75.speaker: Player
75.text: I will respect our truce, if you do the same.
75.context: NodeContext: Trying to be reasonable/diplomatic after a near-fatal blowout with Lae'zel

93.speaker: Shadowheart
93.text: You took the words right out of my mouth.
93.context: NodeContext: Trying to be reasonable/diplomatic after a near-fatal blowout with Lae'zel

103.speaker: Shadowheart
103.text: I lost more than a few comrades to your kin, but we were infiltrating githyanki territory. Blood was spilled on both sides - just soldiers following orders.
103.context: NodeContext: Trying to be reasonable/diplomatic after a near-fatal blowout with Lae'zel

156.speaker: Shadowheart
156.text: Yet I no longer follow those orders. Shar has abandoned me. The artefact is no longer my mission - saving my family is.
156.context: NodeContext: Trying to be reasonable/diplomatic after a near-fatal blowout with Lae'zel

52.speaker: Shadowheart
52.text: And yet, it seems the one who gave those orders has run afoul of my goddess. Delivering the artefact is no longer my mission - cleansing Lady Shar's church is my mission.
52.context: NodeContext: Trying to be reasonable/diplomatic after a near-fatal blowout with Lae'zel

8.speaker: Shadowheart
8.text: Perhaps we can... come to an arrangement.
8.context: NodeContext: Trying to be reasonable/diplomatic after a near-fatal blowout with Lae'zel

245.speaker: Player
245.context: NodeContext: Trying to be reasonable/diplomatic after a near-fatal blowout with Lae'zel

123.speaker: Shadowheart
123.text: Having one less enemy to worry about mightn't count for much - not with the odds we're facing... but having more than that - an ally to count on, or even a, well...
123.context: NodeContext: Trying to be reasonable/diplomatic after a near-fatal blowout with Lae'zel

222.speaker: Player
222.text: You want to be friends? What a foolish notion.
222.context: NodeContext: Trying to be reasonable/diplomatic after a near-fatal blowout with Lae'zel

58.speaker: Shadowheart
58.text: Of course it is, and I said nothing about friendship. But a little less tension between us might benefit all.
58.context: NodeContext: Trying to be reasonable/diplomatic after a near-fatal blowout with Lae'zel

255.speaker: Shadowheart
255.text: And... I'm sorry. For creeping up on you with a dagger. It won't happen again.

253.speaker: Player
253.text: If it did, I'd show you no mercy.

198.speaker: Shadowheart
198.text: I'll try poison next time. That was a joke, just to be clear.

65.speaker: Player
65.text: Your stealth was commendable. Your flaw was to talk rather than strike.

184.speaker: Shadowheart
184.text: Thank you for the advice. See? We have much to learn from each other.

109.speaker: Player
109.text: If I were in your position, I'd probably have done the same.
109.context: NodeContext: Trying to be reasonable/diplomatic after a near-fatal blowout with Lae'zel

246.speaker: Shadowheart
246.text: Well, at least I know I won't find you atop me in the middle of the night now.
246.context: NodeContext: Trying to be reasonable/diplomatic after a near-fatal blowout with Lae'zel

18.speaker: Shadowheart
18.text: I mean... never mind. Let's consider the matter settled.
18.context: NodeContext: Slight stammer on unintended innuendo.

237.speaker: Player
237.text: I've made enough enemies. I'd welcome a kinship.
237.context: NodeContext: Trying to be reasonable/diplomatic after a near-fatal blowout with Lae'zel

170.speaker: Shadowheart
170.context: NodeContext: Trying to be reasonable/diplomatic after a near-fatal blowout with Lae'zel

95.speaker: Player
95.text: Some manner of cooperation, you mean?
95.context: NodeContext: Trying to be reasonable/diplomatic after a near-fatal blowout with Lae'zel

248.speaker: Shadowheart
248.text: We already do that, by and large. We journey together, fight together, share food and campfire...
248.context: NodeContext: Trying to be reasonable/diplomatic after a near-fatal blowout with Lae'zel

249.speaker: Player
249.text: I want only a truce. Spare me your blade, and I'll do the same.

229.speaker: Shadowheart
229.text: Very well. At least you are consistent.

91.speaker: Shadowheart
91.text: But there are bigger, more immediate concerns. Let's put survival first, for now.

21.speaker: Player
21.text: I let you keep your head. But that doesn't mean you have my trust.

166.speaker: Shadowheart
166.text: The feeling's mutual. I didn't think it needed to be stated again, frankly.

57.speaker: Shadowheart
57.text: We still have use for each other. But perhaps one day, that will no longer be the case.

252.speaker: Shadowheart
252.context: InternalNodeContext: Companion confronts Avatar Astarion, telling him they know he's a vampire. Triggers if you make it to Act 2 without him telling you himself or revealing it via camp night bite scene/using bite attack in front of you.

154.speaker: Shadowheart
154.text: Let's not dance around the subject - I know you're a vampire.
154.context: NodeContext: Self-awarness/outreach (referring to her outed secret about being a shar worshipper)

20.speaker: Player
20.text: I see... and what gave me away?
20.context: NodeContext: Self-awarness/outreach (referring to her outed secret about being a shar worshipper)

221.speaker: Shadowheart
221.text: Let me see - the deathly-pale skin? The red eyes? The fangs? I'm not blind, you know.

231.speaker: Player
231.context: NodeContext: Self-awarness/outreach (referring to her outed secret about being a shar worshipper)

19.speaker: Shadowheart
19.text: The distinction's lost on me, if you still feed on blood.
19.context: NodeContext: Self-awarness/outreach (referring to her outed secret about being a shar worshipper)

96.speaker: Shadowheart
96.context: NodeContext: Self-awarness/outreach (referring to her outed secret about being a shar worshipper)

183.speaker: Player
183.text: It's bad for my health. When I tell the truth, wooden stakes start appearing in people's hands.
183.context: NodeContext: Self-awarness/outreach (referring to her outed secret about being a shar worshipper)

134.speaker: Shadowheart
134.text: I suppose I can understand that. More than most, perhaps.
134.context: NodeContext: Self-awarness/outreach (referring to her outed secret about being a shar worshipper)

41.speaker: Shadowheart
41.text: I suppose I can understand that. More than most, perhaps.
41.context: NodeContext: Self-awarness/outreach (referring to her outed secret about being a shar worshipper)

171.speaker: Shadowheart
171.context: NodeContext: Self-awarness/outreach (referring to her outed secret about being a shar worshipper)

161.speaker: Player
161.text: You, of all people, cannot criticise me on the subject of keeping secrets.
161.context: NodeContext: Self-awarness/outreach (referring to her outed secret about being a shar worshipper)

100.speaker: Shadowheart
100.text: The hypocrisy isn't lost on me. If anything, it makes me more likely to be sympathetic to you than anyone else.
100.context: NodeContext: Self-awarness/outreach (referring to her outed secret about being a shar worshipper)

11.speaker: Player
11.text: A little ironic, no? I have a feeling you have a few secrets of your own. More than a few, in fact.
11.context: NodeContext: Poker face. Veiled reference to the fact her shar worship is a secret at present

54.speaker: Shadowheart
54.text: Perhaps I'm a better liar than you are, then. All the more reason to be honest with me - I'll see right through you.
54.context: NodeContext: Poker face. Veiled reference to the fact her shar worship is a secret at present

217.speaker: Player
217.text: No more secrets, on my honour.
217.context: NodeContext: Teasing/not intended to sound too harsh.

26.speaker: Shadowheart
26.text: I'll take it on good faith that such a thing exists.
26.context: NodeContext: Teasing/not intended to sound too harsh.

195.speaker: Shadowheart
195.text: Now that we have some semblance of an understanding, did you want anything else?

2.speaker: Player
2.text: I can promise you fewer secrets?
2.context: NodeContext: Teasing/not intended to sound too harsh.

79.speaker: Shadowheart
79.text: Coming from you, I'll take that as a victory.
79.context: NodeContext: Teasing/not intended to sound too harsh.

6.speaker: Player
6.text: Secrets keep me safe. You'll just have to live with that.

111.speaker: Shadowheart
111.text: Indeed. Though perhaps not always with you by my side.

203.text: You think I wouldn't have understood? We've all got a bigger problem to contend with - we need to be able to rely on one another.

226.speaker: Shadowheart
226.text: You think I wouldn't have understood? We've all got a bigger problem to contend with - we need to be able to rely on one another.

172.speaker: Shadowheart
172.text: The truth's out now, no thanks to you. No more secrets, understand?

209.speaker: Shadowheart
209.text: My master forbid me from revealing my true nature.

143.speaker: Player
143.text: It's no great mystery - I just wasn't sure if I could trust you.

147.speaker: Shadowheart
147.text: I can sympathise. It isn't easy for me to let people know about my faith. Often a lie by omission seems like the safest course.

177.speaker: Shadowheart
177.text: We're all in this together. Provided you can keep your urges in check around me, I don't see why anything has to change.

254.speaker: Shadowheart
254.text: I can sympathise, actually. With some secrets, well... often a lie by omission seems like the safest course.

76.speaker: Player
76.text: Rubbish! Your senses have taken leave of you, Shadowheart.

88.speaker: Shadowheart
88.text: Don't treat me like an idiot, please. Do you think it was easy for me, to try keeping my faith hidden? I know when someone's burdened with a secret.

5.speaker: Shadowheart
5.text: Don't treat me like an idiot, please. I have a talent for recognising when someone has a secret.

200.speaker: Shadowheart
200.text: Besides, just look at yourself. It couldn't be any more obvious.

167.speaker: Player
167.text: I swear to you - I am not a vampire.

69.speaker: Shadowheart
69.text: You're a bad liar. And perhaps an untrustworthy ally.

42.speaker: Shadowheart
42.text: Best if you leave me alone, for now.
